comment.text: Catalyzes the oxidative deamination of biogenic and xenobiotic amines and has important functions in the metabolism of neuroactive and vasoactive amines in the central nervous system and peripheral tissues. MAOB preferentially degrades benzylamine and phenylethylamine.
RCH(2)NHR' + H(2)O + O(2) = RCHO + R'NH(2) + H(2)O(2).
Monomer, homo- or heterodimer (containing two subunits of similar size). Each subunit contains a covalently bound flavin. Enzymatically active as monomer (By similarity).
Belongs to the flavin monoamine oxidase family.

comment.name: SHMPD
comment.text: The Singapore human mutation and polymorphism database

property.value: Biogenic amines are oxidatively deaminated to aldehydes by MAOA and MAOB
P:positive regulation of dopamine metabolic process

feature.description: Helical; Anchor for type IV membrane protein
